titlestmt.titleproper: George Walker essay on chess undated
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

scopecontent.p: Copy of an essay in the London & Edinburgh Philosophical Magazine, 3rd Series, Vol. 16, p. 498. The essay, addressed to the editor, was written by George Walker, Secretary of the St. George Chess Club and entitled, "On the moving the Knight over every Square of the Chess-board alternately." Walker writes this essay in response to an article describing the chess moves of a Dr. Roget.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Purchased from the heirs of George Allen, Esq.
